name: sliver

procedures: T1001.002::[Sliver] can encode binary data into a .PNG file for C2 communication.
T1016::[Sliver] has the ability to gather network configuration information.
T1027::[Sliver] can encrypt strings at compile time.
T1041::[Sliver] can exfiltrate files from the victim using the download command.
T1049::[Sliver] can collect network connection information.
T1055::[Sliver] can inject code into local and remote processes.
T1071.001::[Sliver] has the ability to support C2 communications over HTTP/S.
T1071.004::[Sliver] can support C2 communications over DNS.
T1083::[Sliver] can enumerate files on a target system.
T1105::[Sliver] can upload files from the C2 server to the victim machine using the upload command.
T1113::[Sliver] can take screenshots of the victimâ€™s active display.
T1132.001::[Sliver] can use standard encoding techniques like gzip and hex to ASCII to encode the C2 communication payload.
T1134::[Sliver] has the ability to manipulate user tokens on targeted Windows systems.
T1573.001::[Sliver] can use AES-GCM-256 to encrypt a session key for C2 message exchange.
T1573.002::[Sliver] can use mutual TLS and RSA  cryptography to exchange a session key.

description: [Sliver](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0633) is an open source, cross-platform, red team command and control framework written in Golang.(Citation: Bishop Fox Sliver Framework August 2019)
